TextView.android:text: If you desire to be a gladiator who can take over any opponent, here\'s the greatest opportunity for you.\n\nTATHVA 12 presents a spectacular event where your bot is the gladiator and you feel the thirst for victory. So get ready for the ultimate battle of bots and feel the heat of the arena.

1. Maximum number of members per team is 4.
2. The diagram above represents a sample arena.
3. The arena will be consisting of 2 wedges, 4 coloured regions and 2 pairs of grills with
3 sets of openings. It will have a fence except at the grills.
4. A and B are the starting positions.
5. There are 2 pairs of grills with 3 sets of openings in each.
6. Both the bots, at their maximum size (all retractable projections included) should fit
into a box of dimensions 30cm x 30cm x 30cm. The measurements shall be done
just before the start of the match.
7. The weight of the machine should not exceed 10kg.
8. After every scoring session there will be a reset (back to the starting position).
9. The teams will be divided into groups depending upon the number of participants.
10. In the league matches the team with maximum number of wins will get into the next
level.Each league match shall be 8 minutes long with a half time of 4 minutes.
11. Pneumatics weaponry can be used.
12. Robots can have any kind of miniature weapons with the following exceptions and
limitations:
○ Hydraulics.
○ Liquid projectiles.
○ Flame­based weapons.
○ Nets, tape, glue, or any other entanglement device.
○ Projectiles.
○ Weapons should not come in contact with the arena or damage it.
○ Radio jammers.
13. There should be no entanglement of the wires during the match.
14. If a bot remains stationary for a time of 30 seconds, the opposition will be declared as
winner.
15. An interrupt will be given if and only if any technical problem occurs in between the
match, but a penalty of 25 points will be awarded.
○ Only the wireless one will get first interrupt for free.
○ Maximum number of interrupts allowed in a match are 3.
16. Only electrical powered actuators are allowed. The power supply may be onboard or
external. A maximum voltage of 24V D.C/A.C can be used to power the vehicle.
17. The wires should be projected to a minimum height of 25 cm.
18. Participants should bring the required length of wire (minimum 3.5 meters along with
them. The wires should remain slack throughout the match).
19. A tolerance of 5% is allowed in the above mentioned dimensional & power
specifications, taking into consideration the error of the measuring instruments that
we use here and those used by the participants in the making of the robot. This
relaxation is scientific & tolerable.
20. Ready­made chassis are not allowed and would lead to the disqualification of the
team.
Design and build a remote controlled robot (wired/ wireless) that can play a wrestling match against a similar bot from an opposing team in a circular arena, under a stipulated time.\n

First	Rs. 15000/-
Second	Rs. 9000/-
Third	Rs. 6000/-

1. The bots which do not abide by the rules will be disqualified.
2. If the bot is of wireless control the team will be given a bonus of 75 points.
3. If a bot falls from the end of the wedge the opposite team will be awarded 100 points.
4. If a bot falls from the side of the wedge the opposite team will be awarded 50 points.
5. If one bot falls from the end and the other from the side, then the one which has fallen
from the side will be awarded 25 points.
6. If the bots fall together (i.e both from end or side) no team will be awarded any
points(there will be a reset).
7. If a bot pushes the other one into the blue coloured region completely then it will be
awarded 50 points.
8. If a bot pushes the other one through any of the openings completely then it will be
awarded 75 points.
9. If a tie exists after any match, the team which got more number of points through the
wedges will be declared as winner.
10. If the tie still exists, the one which got more number of points through the grills will be
declared as winner.
11. If there still is a tie, the one which got more number of points through the colour region
will be declared as winner.
12. If the tie still exists, the decision will be taken by the judges.
13. Coordinator's decision will be final and binding in all respects.
